Mission.Author: KingRaptor
Mission.Description: Learn essentials of controlling the Zero-K economy.
Mission.Name: Economy Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action
TriggerLogic.CodeStr:
local units = GG.mission.FindUnitsInGroup("Gaia") for unitID in pairs(units) do Spring.TransferUnit(unitID, Spring.GetGaiaTeamID(), false) end
Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_has_next_button", 1)

TriggerLogic.Name: Add Objective
TriggerLogic.Description: Learn how to obtain resources and use them to build units to defeat the enemy.
TriggerLogic.Title: Complete Economy Tutorial

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
\255\255\255\0\Metal\008 is a basic resource needed to construct units and buildings. The primary source of metal is the \255\0\255\255\Metal Extractor\008 shown here.
Click Next to continue.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("mex", 1915, 85, "Metal Extractor") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Metal can also be obtained by \255\255\255\0\reclaiming\008 the \255\255\255\0\wreckages\008 that dead units leave on the battlefield. Select your commander and \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on a wreck to reclaim it.
Reclaim the three wreckages to the \255\255\255\0\left\008 to continue.
TIP: Hold down \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 when issuing orders to queue them.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.RemovePoint("mex") WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("feature1", 1600, 120) WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("feature2", 1400, 165) WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("feature3", 1200, 120) end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message: Construction units (including the commander) can \255\255\255\0\repair\008 damaged units. Select your commander and \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the damaged storage building to repair it.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.ClearPoints() WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("storage", 920, 65, "Repair me") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Reclaim and repair can be given as \255\255\255\0\area commands\008. Press \255\0\255\0\R\008 and \255\0\255\0\left click and drag\008 a circle on the ground to issue an area repair command. Reclaim is the same, except the hotkey is \255\0\255\0\E\008.
Repair the solar collectors and reclaim the wreckages using area commands to continue.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.ClearPoints() WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("cleanup", 690, 190, "Reclaim and repair") end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Now that we have our stuff up and running, let's take a look at something else.
\255\255\255\0\Energy\008 is the other basic resource. You need an equal amount of metal and energy to build things, and energy is also used to repair units and operate certain abilities like cloaking.
You can see your current metal and energy in the \255\255\255\0\resource panel\008 at the top of the screen (highlighted). It shows how much you're earning, how much you have stored and how much you're spending.
Click Next to continue.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.ChiliHighlight then WG.ChiliHighlight.AddControl("Metal", nil, true, 4) WG.ChiliHighlight.AddControl("Energy", nil, true, 4) end if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.ClearPoints() end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Several buildings produce energy, but the \255\0\255\255\Solar Collector\008 is the most basic. Let's build one. + Select your commander + Click the \255\255\255\0\Econ\008 tab in the menu (highlighted) + Left click the Solar Collector button + Left click on the ground where you want to place the building
TIP: Hold down \255\0\255\0\Shift\008 to click and drag a line of buildings. If you accidentally stop construction, \255\0\255\0\right click\008 the unfinished building to resume.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Good work. Now let's make a \255\0\255\255\Metal Extractor\008 ("mex" for short) as well.
Metal extractors can only be built on \255\255\255\0\metal spots\008. You can make them in the same way as the Solar Collector, but it's easier to use the \255\255\255\0\area mex\008 command: + Select your commander + Left click the \255\255\255\0\Orders\008 tab in the menu + Press \255\0\255\0\W\008 + \255\0\255\0\Left click and drag\008 a circle on the ground
If you're having trouble finding metal spots, press \255\0\255\0\F4\008 for the economy view.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Notice the colored circles on the ground when a mex or solar collector is selected. They represent the \255\255\255\0\overdrive\008 grid.
Overdrive lets mexes produce more metal from surplus energy. This requires a \255\255\255\0\grid connection\008 created by making the circles touch. Overdrive \255\255\255\0\becomes less efficient\008 the more energy is used.
\255\0\255\0\Mouse over\008 the mex and solar collector to see how much energy is being converted to metal.
Build a Solar Collector in the designated location to connect the mex and see how overdrive increases its output. Click Next to continue.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action
Custom Action
GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Good. Now that we have metal and energy, it's time to spend it with a \255\255\255\0\factory\008.
Build a \255\0\255\255\Cloaky Bot Factory\008. + Select your commander + Click the Factory tab in the menu (highlighted) + Left click the Cloaky Bot Factory button + Left click on the ground where you want to place the building
The factory icon over your commanders' head means you have a free factory ready to deploy (a "\255\255\255\0\facplop\008").

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Let's make some units with our factory. Build three \255\0\255\255\Glaive\008 bots.
+ Select your new factory + Left click the \255\255\255\0\Units\008 tab + Left click Glaive three times

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
That was easy. But having to give your factory fresh build orders each time can be troublesome. Use the \255\255\255\0\Repeat\008 order to make your factory keep pumping out units.
+ Select your factory + Click the repeat button + Left click Glaive
Build three more Glaives. But here's the catch: your factory \255\255\255\0\must have Repeat on\008 or it will not build anything.

TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.ChiliHighlight then WG.ChiliHighlight.ClearControls() -- highlight repeat button WG.ChiliHighlight.AddControlFunc("repeat", function() return {WG.IntegralMenu.GetCommandButtonPosition(CMD.REPEAT)} end, nil, true) end

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Action
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: Spring.SetGameRulesParam("tutorial_stage", 12) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(CMD.GUARD) GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(13921) -- factory guard GG.CommandLocker.UnlockCMD(13922) -- area guard

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
You can give construction units a \255\255\255\0\Guard\008 order on a factory to \255\255\255\0\assist\008 it and help it build faster. Select your commander and \255\0\255\0\right click\008 on the factory.
Build five more Glaives. Same deal as before; your commander needs to be assisting the factory or it won't build.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
Well done.
There's one last thing left to do. Somewhere in the lowlands is an \255\255\255\0\enemy factory\008. Use your newly built units and destroy it.
TIP: You can give move/attack move/etc. orders to a factory and the units it builds will inherit the order queue.

TriggerLogic.Name: Custom Marker
TriggerLogic.CodeStr: if WG.CustomMarker then WG.CustomMarker.AddPoint("enemyBase", 2330, 2670, "Enemy factory", {1, 0.5, 0.5}) end

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message (Persistent)
TriggerLogic.Message:
And there she goes.
That concludes the tutorial. Click Next to finish.

TriggerLogic.Name: GUI Message
TriggerLogic.Message:
So you're back. Let's get started on the economy training.
Close this message when you're ready to begin.
